Reviews.Title: Quite satisfied!
Reviews.Author: aerich "aerrich"
Reviews.Content: I didn't find a lot of feedback on this new model during my research so thought I'd share what I've learned. My settings:PICTURE SETTINGSPicture Mode StandardBacklight 7 *12 is default (I brought this up to 10 after the burn in period (2-3 months after purchase).Contrast 70 *100 is defaultBrightness 30 *45 is default (I brought this up to 50 after burn in period).Sharpness 50Color 55 *50 is defaultTint G50/R50Advanced Settings submenu:Color Space NativeWhite Balance R-Offset 20, R-Gain 20 *25 is the default for every valueGamma 0Dynamic Contrast Off *High is defaultBlack Tone OffFlesh Tone 0Motion Lighting OffPicture Options submenu:Color Tone StandardSize Screen Fit *16:9 is defaultDigital Noise Filter Off *Auto is defaultHDMI Black Level Normal (grayed out)Film Mode Off (grayed out)Auto Motion Plus Off *Standard is defaultLED Motion Plus OffPLUG & PLAY SETTINGSEco Solution submenu: Energy Saving OffThe asterisk* indicates the settings where I deviated from default and the original value.The settings above make the sweet spot directly in front of the screen look the best for me from both low and high definition sources. Angled views are still perfectly viewable but the colors/brightness will be a bit muted and the image won't "pop" with a 3d like effect outside the sweet spot. You can easily optimize for angled viewing by doing a picture reset to return to the default picture settings, defaults don't look too great within the sweet spot though. All LED screens have this issue with angled viewing, using an articulated swivel wall mount makes this drawback much easier to live with. Mount-It MI-3110B works well.Image quality is top shelf, the best picture you're going to find in an LED that isn't capable of 4K Ultra HD and the lack of 3D is fine as I'd never use it anyway. The screen is about as barebones as you can get with no smart features, no audio out, and only two hmdi ports. This is a good thing as there are less points of failure and it runs cooler which increases the life of the product. All you truly need is a big monitor as every feature you desire is best done using separate components anyway. I wish Samsung had just gone all out in this direction and left off the tuner and speakers as well. The USB port reads any file type you throw at it but is rather useless for anything but pictures as any audio will only play through the anemic built in speakers.I haven't had this long so I'll come back to update the review if I end up revising my settings.Edit 2/18/14 - I've only had to adjust the backlight and brightness as the LED's burned in and became darker which is normal. So the original settings still stand when the set is new but as it ages you should slowly bump up the brightness and backlight to compensate when it starts to get darker. I've had them at 10 and 50 for a couple months now which is where it seems to have stabilized at this point.

Reviews.Title: 3 bad reviews(or non reviews) ruined this TV rating
Reviews.Author: Dovetail65
Reviews.Content: 3 bad reviews ruined this TV ratingThis is a good TV, for the money this is a fantastic TV, maybe one of the best values available.One person seemed to make two rants with both 1 and 2 star ratings complaining about the manufacturer for a different product and another 1 star rating complaining about shipping. This is exactly why reviews should only be for the product! Take out those 3 Non-reviews and this would have 4.5 stars and that is what this TV deserves 4.5 stars, I will round to 5 to counter act the 3 reviews that are not applicable to the quality of the TV.To my eye the TV is better than any LCD I have seen and I eve prefer it over the LED, only the newest full back lit TV seem to compare , again to my eye. I just followed the settings a couple guys here posted and actually I can barley tell the difference. My unit seemed to be great out of the box or maybe I am just not as picky. Coming from a 720P using an internet connection to watching a DVD on this just blows me away. I would not hesitate to get this TV.Just some hints always use Amazon Prime when buying through Amazon, especially a large purchase like this just in case the shipping goes bad, etc. And keep the box. Amazon will take it back for 30 days and if you scream loud enough maybe even longer . Don't call the manufacturer unless you have to, always go to Amazon first if electronic device goes bad in the first month or two. I read so many review where people will say the TV broke in 4 days and they waited for a repairman what? Send it back free through Amazon and get a new one if it conks out that soon!

Reviews.Title: Misrepresented, No digital out but great picture
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This product is misrepresented.  You should be aware that there is NO digital audio out.  If you need to use a surround sound system, or any external speakers (and you'll need to since the internal speakers on this are not so great), you will end up having to buy other equipment to pull the audio out of the hdmi stream before the hdmi enters the tv (ex. An hdmi switch with digital audio out).  Also, there are only 2 hdmi ports on this tv, one of which only accepts video (dvi in), further necessitating an hdmi switch.  All that being said, the picture is amazing, and this product should really be looked at as a 60" monitor with a great picture and built in speakers (which won't cut it).  If this tv had the digital out it states it does, it would have gotten 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Best picture quality in it's class.
Reviews.Author: M. A. Baker
Reviews.Content: I am thoroughly satisfied with my purchase. I'm no expert at calibration however, I ended up turning most of the attributes down seeing as the default settings are rather bright out of the box. This is a plus for daytime viewing. It can be as bright as you need it, or look great in the dark. The color representation is natural and black levels are fantastic. No money was wasted on SmartTV that I won't use or 3D that makes my eyes dry and make my head dizzy. Samsung is the king of LED's!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Amazing Picture, and great special delivery!
Reviews.Author: Go Hawks
Reviews.Content: We read all of the reviews on this TV and decided to purchase it on Black Friday. We replaced a 57 inch Mitsubishi DLP test was 1080.  I have to say all of the reviews that raved about the picture quality are 100% right on---THE PICTURE ON THIS TV IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!  We tweaked the settings using the recommendations in the Amazon reviews and they were right on.  The images pop out of its TV like it is 3D.  I am amazed at what a great picture this has. It is so sharp you can easily see the smallest details in what you're watching.  I can't recommend. This TV enough! Amazon had a delivery service drop it off and unpack it to be sure nothing was wrong. This was a great touch and since we live in AZ it's nice to know it wasn't sitting and bumping around in a UPS truck all day.  Well done Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Moving from DLP to this...wow
Reviews.Author: David Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Retiring a malfunctioning DLP 56" and all we wanted was a TV, not a smart TV, just a TV. This model fit the bill just right.First: Only 2 HDMI inputs - Not a deal breaker for us. Our DVD, Blu-ray, cable box, etc. are routed through our receiver so only one HDMI cable going to the TV.Second: No audio output - Not a deal breaker for us. The built in speakers actually do sound quite good in our listening environment. More than adequate for casual TV listening. Your experience may vary. For a wake the neighbors kind of sound experience we use the sound from the receiver.(If I'm not mistaken the sister TV, EH6003 has an audio output which might be the source of the confusion on this matter)Now the fun part sharing how very, very nice this TV is which we found for $899.99.1. Easy peasy set up.2. Great picture right out of the box considering we're upgrading from an old 56" DLP set.3. Only a little tinkering with some of the settings using as a guide picture settings others have shared here and elsewhere and the THX set up feature on a Pixar Blu-ray and Avatar never looked so good.4. Remote control is easy to use with all buttons well marked. However, some of the buttons may feel a bit small for some users, it is a compact remote.5. Another plus is that because this is not a smart TV it means the remote is not cluttered with little to never used buttons.6. Onscreen menus provide short explanation for each function you highlight before you make any changes.Any downers for us? Very minor ones1. The Owner's Manual is the fold out map variety which means smallish type and not real handy to use. It has all the necessary info but any prior experience with a Samsung TV and their menus will serve you well here.2. Wish the remote used AA instead of AAA batteries3. Seemed just a wee bit flexy on its base though I suspect this is the case with all larger screens and not really a design fault. And I have to admit I was pushing on the TV to see what would happen to satisfy my own curiosity. I was satisfied that it was stable enough. But if I were you I would still try to keep youngsters and relatives with a history of clumsiness away from the TV. Or mount it using a wall bracket.We are very pleased with this TV and look forward to many hours of viewing pleasure.1-21-14 Amendment: TV does seem to have a sweet spot for viewing and viewers too far off axis may notice the far side of the screen appearing a bit lighter than the side they are closest to. And though the TV shows amazing image quality from Blu-ray my initial impression is that our old DLP did a better initial job with broadcast TV for which our source Comcast cable. Tinkering with the settings continues.

Reviews.Title: Great No-Frills HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Utley
Reviews.Content: If you don't want all the bells and whistles in a Hi-Def television, this Samsung is one to consider.  Sixty inch class televisions are great for the den, and I was pleasantly surprised at how large the screen is in my parents' home--it's hard to judge at the store when comparing televisions at places like BestBuy because they are usually displayed on huge walls amongst other TVs with larger screens.  More importantly, the 60 inch class of televisions are very affordable before the next significant jump in prices for larger screens.  I bought this HDTV as a Christmas gift for my senior parents and it is really all they need.  Amazon featured the lowest price around, and even though I was a little apprehensive about buying from an online store, the shipping carrier was very easy to work with, and the product shipped without any glitches.  I would buy the same television for myself!

Reviews.Title: Correction to my previous review.
Reviews.Author: paul cornett
Reviews.Content: After a slow start in getting the unit, not amazon's fault, I was very pleased with it in every way. The picture quality is outstanding.  Great in every way.

Reviews.Title: Great picture after adjusting.
Reviews.Author: Kelly Slavens "kwslavens"
Reviews.Content: Picked up a warehouse deal on this TV. Product arrived in perfect condition and after following some only adjustment guides the picture quality is outstanding. Couldn't ask for better.

Reviews.Title: I recommend this product.  Check out all features before purchase.
Reviews.Author: Bryan T Deal
Reviews.Content: Did not have the audio output feature I wanted but I like picture quality alot.Price was better than most places.

Reviews.Title: Product is so good
Reviews.Author: BAEK BONG GI
Reviews.Content: However, there is no local settings KoreanBut I'm satisfiedI want to buy next timeRecommended to those who worry

Reviews.Title: Samsung awesome!
Reviews.Author: William P. Danos "bluetooth"
Reviews.Content: So far, we love this TV, great picture right out the box, easy set up with white glove delivery and connection to Direct TV HD receiver and their version of online connection.  I have enough smart phone and I pads w/o needing my TV do do all that stuff.  Also easy connection to Bose surround sound since that was already hooked up through my Direct TV receiver.  The DVD/Blue-ray connection is easy as well with either RCA jacks or the extra HDMI slot which was empty.  This hi tech world is challenging for 66 year old guys but I'm hanging in there so far, and I can always ask my 5 year old grand daughter if confused.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture & Reasonable Sound for $898
Reviews.Author: Erica S. Heitke
Reviews.Content: It looks amazing. The picture clarity is excellent. I like the nice sturdy base. Plus it has a nice quality remote that is easy to use. I really like that I can play an mp4 on it just by plugging in a usb stick. The sound it's pretty good considering that we used to have external speakers in the room, but sometimes we do have to turn it all the way up. If you plan on using a cable box or a receiver then wouldn't even matter. I like to use it with my Chromecast.

Reviews.Title: Great display, great value
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I needed a large screen TV to replace my 10 year old 50 inch plasma screen TV. I don't require smart TV features because I already have devices that handle those functions for me (e.g. XBOX, HTPC, Roku, etc.). The Samsung UN60FH6004 has filled that need very well. Picture quality is very good, and the matte screen handles glare well.As with all LED displays, a proper calibration is required to get the most out of the display, (just Google TV calibration for an easy how to).

Reviews.Title: Good Enough for the $$$
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: As you walk the stores comparing TV's all of the pictures look good and any differences would disappear once home without another set to compare too. However the one thing that does stand out is glare and that is what I tried to shop for, i.e. a lack thereoff.  This has more glare than the matte DLP set it replaced but IMO it does a lot better than most other brands currently available.  I stream with Roku so I didn't feel the need for a smart TV.  My sound comes through a surround sound system so I don't know how good the TV speakers are.  The picture has meets my expectations in HD and is outstanding with blue ray.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Bren McRae "Bren McRae"
Reviews.Content: Its actually a 240 refresh rate, not a 120.  Amazing tv. Have had it for a month now and its incredible, no clouds and looks great.

Reviews.Title: SWEET
Reviews.Author: Kristie Clark
Reviews.Content: This is bigger then I need but hey I have a Great 60 inch TV at a good price. Who doesn't want that?

Reviews.Title: Best picture for a reasonable price for 'old school' non-Smart flat screen.
Reviews.Author: BURLGIRL
Reviews.Content: Picked this up at BJs Wholesale Club for $899 which was advertised with a $400 instant rebate off regular price. We didn't want SmartTV nor the 3D features. Could not setup with my 2003 Sony surround sound system as there aren't enough RCA plugs. (HDMI feature may work fine with folks newer stereo components though).  Picture is taking quite a few tries at adjusting the correct tint, contrast, RGB scale. Sound is just OK.  DVD player hooked up but now I need to have TV on to play a CD to hear the music.OK for "old school" TV viewing. I'll stick with my Kindle to watch AMazon Prime movies & TV in my home office or while commuting.

Reviews.Title: 60" TV review
Reviews.Author: Edward Jinkens
Reviews.Content: I was really glad to finally get my TV delivered, the TV is great but the delivery was not. Once I got the notice the TV had shipped I was given a tracking number and a delivery date. I was told the carrier would contact me with information about the delivery, after a week I started contacting Amazon and told them the carrier hadn't contacted me. I was given the carriers e-mail and phone number instead of Amazon contacting the carrier. I called the carrier and the day it was to deliver between 1 pm and 6 pm that day, I told the lady it was already 3 pm and she said don't worry they will be there. The carrier never showed, this was a Friday, carrier called on the next Monday saying they would deliver Tuesday between 4pm and 6pm. The driver showed up at 6:30 pm. I love my TV but not to happy with Amazon since they wouldn't do anything to try and help out with my problem.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Gary Moise
Reviews.Content: Going from a 42 inch LCD Vizo to a 60 inch LED Samsung is a "BIG" difference lol.  Great picture

Reviews.Title: Awsome value
Reviews.Author: Paul Bertrand
Reviews.Content: This tv is awsome!! Has a stunning picture and the sound is great. Mounted correctly it is an awsome addition to your media experience, i would recommend this to a friend. Cable is my source for tv service. Happy Happy Happy!!!!

Reviews.Title: Paid to send it back
Reviews.Author: G. Adkins
Reviews.Content: In spite of the other excellent reviews, I was quite disappointed with this TV.  We were coming from an excellent Toshiba rear-projection CRT set, and couldn't take the lack of depth and odd looking color.  I worked and worked with it, but everything (including Bluray of LOTR) looked to me like I was watching a soap opera.  I have a smaller 32" Haier TV in my office, and this TV looked worse than the Haier to me!I ended up paying Amazon sixty dollars to take it back, and bought an LG Plasma for 300 less.  The plasma has a MUCH more enjoyable picture with blacker blacks and realistic skin tones.If you're used to a great TV with great color, blacks, and no motion artifacts, avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: Nice, but...
Reviews.Author: east newport
Reviews.Content: Great picture, easy hookup, very light. issues with usb video playback still unresolved with online support (sent me a 2009 link to resolve picture quality on a computer.)

Reviews.Title: Picture ok but many other issues!
Reviews.Author: Cory Sims
Reviews.Content: Didn't provide any information about tv. Tv have a crack on top of screen. Its bent in the back. Also it only have 2 hdmi ports and one of them don't work! Volume is not good on tv either!

Reviews.Title: Don't love things that can't love you back!
Reviews.Author: SORBEE
Reviews.Content: I would have rated it "I Love it" but- the axiom is a true one and keeps my marriage safe!  The boob tube of the 21st century has delivered!  Couch sores have never been larger!This unit is great for older tech! (yes, 1 year out and other things are now better).  All of the positive reviews you read are well deserved for this unitDOWNSIDE- What's up with no VGA connection? I'm from the 20th century- old techie.

Reviews.Title: A Bargain,But
Reviews.Author: william e. henry jr.
Reviews.Content: With help from my friends at Radio Shack I was able to hook up all my components [cable,home theater,DVD/VCR etc.] to the TV. The multi fold "bed sheet" Owners Guide from Samsung was nearly useless. No comparison to Sony or Toshiba's manuals.The TV's picture in HD is excellent. Audio is satisfactory. For movies and DVD's I route through the Home Theater six speaker system.Tell Sam to hire a US born Korean-American for translation!

Reviews.Title: Only has 2 HDMI Ports and no Optical ports so don't even think about a surround sound system with this TV
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV expecting to be able use a  surround sound system in my home only to find out this TV has no OPTICAL input jack. This TV only has 2 HDMI ports so don't expect to be able to hook up more then 2 items. If you are going to want to play with PlayStation or Wii and hook up other things get a TV with more ports. The TV itself works and looks great.

Reviews.Title: ****SAMSUNG MAKES DEFECTIVE PRODUCTS****
Reviews.Author: Just Sayin'
Reviews.Content: *****W A R N I N G*****Do not buy SAMSUNG Televisions!!!  Maybe $2,500.00 - $3,000.00 is not a lot of money for some folks to spend on a television, but it is to me.  This is money I'll never get back, nor derive true enjoyment, nor value from due to the DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG product that I purchased.  After the one year warranty period SAMSUNG Television screens tend to show burn-in and ghosting with horizontal lines, along with very heavy distortion of picture on right side of screen.  This problem is systemic in all their LCD's and LED's.  Consumer's have complained all over the internet.  There are even numerous Youtube postings with the exact same problems as in my DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG model, as well as the same DEFECT in many other DEFECTIVE SAMUNG models.  This defect occurs upon start-up, and lasts for the first 15 minutes of trying to view a program. Then the picture gets progressively worse over time and continuously declines.I tried SAMSUNG's Executive Customer Relations Dept. and was told:  "We will do nothing but refer you to a local Authorized Repair Shop."  They were downright blunt and rude to boot!  I feel robbed of $2,900.00!Furthermore, I was informed that the repair will consist of a diagnosis visit, and then another visit to install a replacement "Panel" that costs $1,300.00 for the part plus $279.00 to install, plus taxes......all told, another $1,719.16....at which point the technician basically stated, "just buy another TV."SAMSUNG customer service also told me that their Televisions depreciate at a rate of 20% per year, and that they do not repair any of their products after 4 years!  Their own repair people told me to just buy a new set!!!If I save one family the heartache of losing they're hard-earned money on SYSTEMICALLY DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS, and a company that offers zero customer service....I'll be happy!  God bless....SAMSUNG CONS:No Customer SupportSystemic Panel DefectGhosting of imagesBurn-in on screenDistorted pictureVery expensive to repair

ProductInfo.Features:
1080p HDTV: Better picture quality
120Hz Refresh Rate: Better for general viewing and good for video games, action movies, and sports
Thin LED Design: TV without stand (Width x Height x Depth): 54.1" x 31.5" x 3.7", TV with stand (Width x Height x Depth): 54.1" x 33.9" x 12.9"
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung UN60FH6003 60-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED TV (2013 Model)
